Controller

Class IOManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.IOManager

  • public class IOManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for the direct interaction with the user. This class deals with getting input from the user as well as printing text and options onto the screen for the user

    • Constructor Summary

      IOManager()

    • Method Detail

      • printMenuTitle

        public static void printMenuTitle(java.lang.String title)
        This method prints the title of each menu view in a pretty format
        Parameters:
        title - The title String of the menu view

      • printMenuOptions

        public static void printMenuOptions(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> options)
        This method helps to print the numbered options in a consistent format. Every menu view will display numbered options for users to choose the option they want. This method can be used for printing such options.
        Parameters:
        options - The ArrayList of strings to be used as the options

      • printMenuContent

        public static void printMenuContent(java.lang.String input)
        This method helps to print String content in any View. This method ensures that the string will automatically go to the next line when it reaches the maximum width of the allowable screen width
        Parameters:
        input - The String content

      • printMultipageOptions

        public static <E> void printMultipageOptions(java.util.ArrayList<E> array,
                                             int numOfOptionsPerPage,
                                             java.lang.String endOptionsChoosingSessionMessage)
        Given an ArrayList of any type, this method helps to transform the list into multi-page options menu and manage the navigation of the pages. This method does not support the selection of the options.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Any type as long as the toString() method is properly configured.
        Parameters:
        array - Array containing objects to be listed as options in this menu
        numOfOptionsPerPage - The maximum number of options allowed for each page
        endOptionsChoosingSessionMessage - The option String that tells user to navigate back to previous View.

      • printMultipageOptionsWithReturnedChoice

        public static <E> int printMultipageOptionsWithReturnedChoice(java.util.ArrayList<E> array,
                                                              int numOfOptionsPerPage)
        Given an ArrayList of any type, this method helps to transform the list into multi-page options menu and manage the navigation of the pages and selection of the element in the multi-page menu options. This method uses the toString() method for each element in the ArrayList to print each option.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Any type as long as the toString() method is properly configured.
        Parameters:
        array - Array containing objects to be listed as options in this menu
        numOfOptionsPerPage - The maximum number of options allowed for each page
        Returns:
        The position of the selected option. (eg 4 if the 4th option is selected). Return -1 if user choose to close this menu to return to previous menu.

      • printDouble

        public static void printDouble(double value,
                               int decimalPlace)
        This method helps to print double value with a specified number of decimal place.
        Parameters:
        value - the double value to be printed
        decimalPlace - the number of decimal places

      • getUserInputString

        public static java.lang.String getUserInputString(java.lang.String message)
        This method is responsible for getting input of type String from the user.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print on the console when asking for user input
        Returns:
        The String value input by user

      • getUserInputInt

        public static int getUserInputInt(java.lang.String message)
        This method is responsible for getting input of type int from the user. Invalid input exception handling is automatically handled in this function.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print on the console when asking for user input
        Returns:
        The int value input by user

      • getUserInputDate

        public static java.time.LocalDate getUserInputDate(java.lang.String message)
        This method is responsible for getting user to input a date value
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print on the console when asking for user input
        Returns:
        The date value input by user, LocalDate object

      • getUserInputInt

        public static int getUserInputInt(java.lang.String message,
                                  int start,
                                  int end)
        This method is responsible for getting input of type int from the user. This method limits the range of acceptable from the user to be between the parameter values, start and end. Invalid input exception handling is automatically handled in this function.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print on the console when asking for user input
        start - The start of the allowed range of values (inclusive)
        end - The end of the allowed range of values (inclusive)
        Returns:
        The int value input by user

      • getUserInputDouble

        public static double getUserInputDouble(java.lang.String message,
                                        double start,
                                        double end)
        This method is responsible for getting input of type double from the user. This method limits the range of acceptable from the user to be between the parameter values, start and end. Invalid input exception handling is automatically handled in this function.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to print on the console when asking for user input
        start - The start of the allowed range of values (inclusive)
        end - The end of the allowed range of values (inclusive)
        Returns:
        The double value input by user
